channel.title: Podigious! A Digimon Podcast!
channel.copyright: 2014 Jeff Ruberg, Ashley McDonnell, and Ash Sofman
channel.itunes:author: Jeff Ruberg, Ashley McDonnell, and Ash Sofman
channel.itunes:summary: A critically nostalgic, analytical podcast tour through the Digimon multiverse.
channel.description: A critically nostalgic, analytical podcast tour through the Digimon multiverse.

itunes:owner.itunes:name: Jeff Ruberg, Ashley McDonnell, and Ash Sofman

item.title: 8. The Vampire Strikes Back
item.itunes:subtitle: The Myotismon Arc (Pt. 3/3)
item.itunes:author: Jeff Ruberg, Ashley McDonnell, and Ash Sofman
item.description: We continue our discussion of Digimon Adventure by covering the rest of the Tokyo section of the Myotismon arc. We discuss relationships, reactions to death, and representations of family and gender. You can find the full show notes for this episode at http://podigious.com/8.
item.itunes:summary: We continue our discussion of Digimon Adventure by covering the rest of the Tokyo section of the Myotismon arc. We discuss relationships, reactions to death, and representations of family and gender. You can find the full show notes for this episode at http://podigious.com/8.
item.content:encoded:
We continue our discussion of Digimon Adventure by covering the rest of the Tokyo section of the Myotismon arc. We discuss relationships, reactions to death, and representations of family and gender.

You can find the full show notes for this episode at http://podigious.com/8.

item.title: 7. Kari is the Eighth DigiDestined?!
item.itunes:subtitle: The Myotismon Arc (Pt. 2/3)
item.itunes:author: Jeff Ruberg, Ashley McDonnell, and Ash Sofman
item.description: We continue our discussion of Digimon Adventure by covering the first half of the Tokyo section of the Myotismon arc. We discuss Tokyo geography, friendship, and gender. You can find the full show notes for this episode at http://podigious.com/7.

item.title: 6. The DigiCenter Cannot Hold
item.itunes:subtitle: The Myotismon Arc (Pt. 1/3)
item.itunes:author: Jeff Ruberg, Ashley McDonnell, and Ash Sofman
item.description: We continue our discussion of Digimon Adventure by covering the digital world section of the Myotismon arc. We discuss crests, biological determinism, serious gender, and serious poop. You can find the full show notes for this episode at http://podigious.com/6.

item.title: 5. Gone Home
item.itunes:subtitle: Home Away From Home
item.itunes:author: Jeff Ruberg, Ashley McDonnell, and Ash Sofman
item.description: We take a break from the normal pace of the show to cover a special episode of Digimon Adventure, Home Away from Home. We discuss tone, responsibility, abandonment, and nostalgia. You can find the full show notes for this episode at http://podigious.com/5.
item.itunes:summary: We take a break from the normal pace of the show to cover a special episode of Digimon Adventure, Home Away from Home. We discuss tone, responsibility, abandonment, and nostalgia. You can find the full show notes for this episode at http://podigious.com/5.

item.title: 3. Angel and Demon

item.itunes:author: Jeff Ruberg, Ashley McDonnell, and Ash Sofman
item.description: We continue our discussion of Digimon Adventure by covering the conclusion of the Devimon and File Island arc. We discuss holidays, peace, childishness, and death. You can find the full show notes for this episode at http://podigious.com/3.

item.title: 2. LOST for Kids
item.itunes:subtitle: File Island and Devimon Pt. 1
item.itunes:author: Jeff Ruberg, Ashley McDonnell, and Ash Sofman
item.description: We dive into our discussion of Digimon Adventure by covering the first part of the File Island arc, up to Devimon's introduction. We discuss gender dynamics, localization, growth, tone, weirdness, and evaluate the arc as an introduction to Digimon. You can find the full show notes for this episode at http://podigious.com/2.
item.itunes:summary: We dive into our discussion of Digimon Adventure by covering the first part of the File Island arc, up to Devimon's introduction. We discuss gender dynamics, localization, growth, tone, weirdness, and evaluate the arc as an introduction to Digimon. You can find the full show notes for this episode at http://podigious.com/2.
item.content:encoded:
We dive into our discussion of Digimon Adventure by covering the first part of the File Island arc, up to Devimon's introduction. We discuss gender dynamics, localization, growth, tone, weirdness, and evaluate the arc as an introduction to Digimon.

You can find the full show notes for this episode at http://podigious.com/2.

item.title: 1. That's Too Much Dinosaur
item.itunes:subtitle: A podcast is born!
item.itunes:author: Jeff Ruberg, Ashley McDonnell, and Ash Sofman
item.description: In the debut episode of Podigious, we discuss our goals for the podcast, and introduce ourselves by talking about our favorite aspects of Digimon. You can find the full show notes for this episode at http://podigious.com/1.
